description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Added workspace-aware owpenbot agent file behavior and outbound send wiring, improving identity and message routing for multi-workspace setups.
- Improved the app UX by defaulting tool steps to collapsed with a latest-action preview and showing the real default routing directory.
Fixes & polish
- Expanded server and dashboard wiring to better support workspace-scoped behavior and status updates.
- Updated identities/settings/message list surfaces to align with the new routing behavior and improve clarity.
- Included AUR metadata updates and synchronized package versions for the v0.11.56 release.
Packaging / ops
- Bumped all release package versions to 0.11.56 and refreshed lockfiles/Cargo metadata.
